# interpret.plot_comparisons { #bambi.interpret.plot_comparisons }

```python
interpret.plot_comparisons(
    model,
    idata,
    contrast,
    conditional=None,
    average_by=None,
    target='mean',
    pps=False,
    comparison='diff',
    use_hdi=True,
    prob=az.rcParams['stats.ci_prob'],
    transforms=None,
    sample_new_groups=False,
    fig_kwargs=None,
    subplot_kwargs=None,
)
```

Plot conditional adjusted comparisons.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

<code>[**model**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[Model](`bambi.models.Model`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   The fitted Bambi model.

<code>[**idata**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[InferenceData](`arviz.InferenceData`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   InferenceData object containing the posterior samples.

<code>[**contrast**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[contrastParam](`contrastParam`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   Variable(s) to create contrasts for.

<code>[**conditional**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[ConditionalParam](`ConditionalParam`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Variables to condition on for comparisons.

<code>[**average_by**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[str](`str`) or [list](`list`) or [bool](`bool`) or None]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Variables to average comparisons over.

<code>[**target**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[str](`str`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [\'mean\']{.parameter-default}</code>

:   The target parameter to compare. Default is "mean".

<code>[**pps**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[bool](`bool`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [False]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Whether to use posterior predictive samples. Default is False.

<code>[**comparison**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[ComparisonFunc](`bambi.interpret.ops.ComparisonFunc`) or [str](`str`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [\'diff\']{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Comparison function or string name. Built-in options: "diff" (difference), "ratio" (ratio), "lift" (relative difference). Default is "diff". Custom functions should accept (reference, contrast) DataArrays and return a DataArray.

<code>[**use_hdi**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[bool](`bool`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [True]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Whether to use highest density interval. Default is True.

<code>[**prob**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[float](`float`) or [list](`list`)\[[float](`float`)\]]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [az.rcParams\[\'stats.ci_prob\'\]]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Probability or list of probabilities for credible intervals. Default is from arviz rcParams. When a list is provided, nested bands with decreasing opacity are drawn.

<code>[**transforms**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[dict](`dict`) or None]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Dictionary of transformations to apply to comparisons.

<code>[**sample_new_groups**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[bool](`bool`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [False]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Whether to sample new group levels. Default is False.

<code>[**fig_kwargs**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[dict](`dict`) or None]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Additional keyword arguments for figure customization. Use the 'theme' key to pass a dictionary of matplotlib rc parameters.

<code>[**subplot_kwargs**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[Mapping](`typing.Mapping`)\[[str](`str`), [str](`str`)\] or None]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Overrides default plotting sequence (main, group, panel).

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

<code>[]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[Plot](`seaborn.objects.Plot`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   A Seaborn objects Plot. In Jupyter notebooks, the plot automatically displays. In scripts, call `.show()` to display. The returned Plot object can be customized before displaying using method chaining (e.g., `.label()`, `.theme()`).

## Raises {.doc-section .doc-section-raises}

<code>[[ValueError](`ValueError`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   If more than 3 conditional variables are provided without averaging.
